ovdesc.p: IS.COMMODITY is the table to define the commodity related features. These are required to define asset related details in Islamic Banking.

desc.p: The maximum quantity in unit(s) in which the commodity can be transacted.
2. No-input field currently. Will be opened for user-input in future.
Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input.

During Commit, the system may generate a series of screen override messages waiting for User Approval. If the record is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown in this field.
Defines the status of the commodity.
The values to the field are defined in the EB.LOOKUP table with prefix "IS.STATUS*".
1. Valid values like Active, Inactive are defined in the EB.LOOKUP table with prefix "IS.STATUS*".
The units in which commodity could be transacted. The values to the field are defined in the EB.LOOKUP table with prefix "IS.UNIT*".
1. Valid Values like Active, Inactive are defined in the EB.LOOKUP table with prefix "IS.UNIT*".
The application in which the asset is defined. This application could be a regular or dynamic table.
1. Any valid application with PGM.TYPE 'H' or 'D'.
The type of the commodity defined. The named commodity are identical to Named Assets like Vehicle, etc. The quantified commodity are identical to commodities like tin, etc.
Denotes the commodity type if the commodity is transacted in local or international
1. Valid values are Local and International.
2. No-input field currently. Will be opened for user-input in future.
Identifies the number of decimals the asset quantity can be transacted.
1. Any numeric value in the range 0-10.
The ID of the table IS.COMMODITY is a numeric value from 1-999. These are Commodity Codes defined for the Islamic Transactions.
The location of the commodity. It could be the warehouse address or the address in which the commodity is present.
2. No-input field currently. Will be opened for user-input in future.
The minimum quantity in unit(s) in which the commodity can be transacted.
2. No-input field currently. Will be opened for user-input in future.
